McDuff79,"2010-08-04T08:32:39.997Z","You must be joking???","

Hey. O.K, I know this probably isn't allowed as a review, but I have to speak my mind with this one.

I've been eyeing up this set since news broke of it on here ages ago. Spotted the news message on here about free postage at lego shop wotsit, so I shot over to check out the set and BOOM! Spied the price tag of £80! SERIOUSLY? I was expecting to pay £40 ish, maybe a little more but £80 is just obscene!

Yes The bus is excellent, yes the tram is lovely, but I know I can pick up a road sweeper and a sportscar for £5 each and the actual platforms, well, they aint all that and a bag of potato chips, to be fair.
I hope this review is permitted. I know it's not much, but I think it's about time lego caught up with themselves a bit here.
Perhaps selling the coach and the tram as seperate sets might prove to be a more prudent and fruitful option?
Yours, an unhappy camper.
p.s, please ignore the brick ratings at the top, except the value for money one.

column1:
Krogh,"2010-10-03T17:55:58.28Z","Worth the price, or waste of money?","

So, i just picked up this set today, and i must say, that the price is insanely high, considering it's meant for children. I know of no parents, that will spend this amount on a gift for their children, at least not in the form of a plastic toy, this is more for dad, than for the kids, and it seems to be the way lego city is headed these days, and that's sad.

I wouldn't have picked it up, but i got a little bonus from work, and found it at a local toys r us. I thought about it for a good 10 minutes, i knew i wanted it, and i knew i didn't want to pay the way to high price, but it has been some time since a bought a lego product, so i finally convinced myself to get it. So, was it worth the price, well, lets take a look at the set. I'll split the review up and talk about the individual parts. First the 3 ""stations"".


Tram station:
column2:
>Calling this a station is a stretch, to say the least. And that goes for the entire set. For the duration of this review, let's just call it a stop. There's really not much to say, it looks great when finished, except it seems a bit tall, it'll look a bit off in your city, seeing as it's 2 stories tall. This is to accomidate the tram, wich is allso fairly tall. It features street lights, wich i think is a nice detail, and these help me overcome the tall construction. Another little detail is the ticket computer.

Bus stop:
column3:
>A standard bus stop, with an odd design, as it has one rounded side roof, and one strait side. A nice little detail is the bike stand, and here's one of the big plusses to this set, the green bike. We also have a recycle bin standing on this platform. The bus stop features nice lego city signs, and a bus stop schedule.

Souvenir shop:
column4: >The last platform is a small shop, there's not much more than a coffee machine, and a stand with some postcards. Oddly enough my set was missing a sticker for one of the postcards. There's a recycle bin, a postbox, and a map of the city.
column10:
>Sports car:
So, iv'e seen some peaople say that it's the same car as the 8402 Sports car
column11: >, and that's not the case, it's not even close. :) it might look scimilar, but the design and pieces used, are not the same at all. Besides, all the newer smaller cars are pretty much built on the same basic frame. It's always nice to have another sportscar racing around your city, though. It looks great, but i still can't understand why the wheels have to stick way out. All in all, it's a fairly standard, but nice little sportscar.
column17:
>City sweeper:

Now, this is actually one of the primary reasons why i got this set. I am collecting, or, at least, trying to collect all the lego city trucks, so, i guess i'd have to get this sooner or later. Unfortunatly, i am somewhat disappointed by this truck. My primary complaint: It's just to short. It's the same length, as the yellow sports car. Otherwise, it's a very simple truck. The brooms are a nice touch though. The driver is positioned on the right side, not the left, some say this is a mistake, but my theory is, that in real life, it would be a lot easier to follow the sidewalk closely, when sitting on the right. Anyway, it's a funny little truck, and a nice variaty from the 7242 street sweeper.


Tour bus:
column18: >Here we have the star of the show, at least in my opinion. I saw this bus back when the first photos were leaked, i had JUST bought the 7641 City Corner
column19:
>, and this tour bus just seemed like such a step up from the yellow city bus. And that's exactly what it turned out to be. The look, the design, the use of pieces, it's all just awesome! This, and this alone makes this set worth getting. It features (Besides the awesome look!) 6 seats, and a drivers seat, doors on both sides of the bus, removable roof, and 2 storage compartments, on each side of the bus. This, is lego city at it's finest.

Tram:
column20: >I am not an expert on trains or trams, and as of the time of this review, i have no experience in lego trains, so i might not know entirely what i am talking about here.
column21:
)
The tram has a nice look, but, how is one suposed to enter the middle car? There must be invisible doors between the cars. :) I think it's a bit to tall, but i can accept it, since it's designed to run on overhanging wires. As i understand it, the tram will fit on standard lego train tracks.
column24: >The set contains 6 minifigs, a female driver for the sports car, a driver for the tram, a driver for the bus, a driver for the sweeper, and 2 civilians, one of wich, is equipped with a suitcase. All fairly standard stuff, all great as allways. :)
column26: >Alright, so as i said (many times), this set is pretty expensive. Is it worth it? I'll leave that up to you, but i will say, that i do not regret getting it, even though my city has no train tracks, hehe.&nbsp
column29:
>Thanks to those who had the endurance to read the entire review! :)

I'll give the set a 4/5.

",TRUE,4,4,5,4,2

column1:
Dodge,"2010-08-17T19:51:42.927Z","A good build","

I
I was looking forward to this set when I first saw the news release about it.
column2: When I saw the initial price of $139.99 I was a bit hesitant, but I'm glad I endulged!

column1: The engineering of this set and the parts included are wonderful!
column2: The tram, which fits on the 9V/remote tracks fit well within the CITY style.&nbsp
column3: The tour bus is an AWESOME design with a great use of pieces.&nbsp
column4: The sports car, street sweeper and platforms are super additions to the set.&nbsp
column5: The sticker set creates some nice touches to the atmosphere.&nbsp

column1: SgtSmash,"2010-09-08T17:17:25.253Z","A lot of stuff for a lot of money!","I was a bit leary&nbsp
column2: paying $99 USD for a set that didn't appear to be&nbsp
column5: vehicles and a light rail train with no tracks, 6 minifigs and some&nbsp
column6: kiosk-type buildings with no baseplate to put them on. But after breaking down and buying this set,&nbsp
column8: was amazed at just how big this set really is (8 bags of parts!), the time it took me to build, and how it incorporated into my Lego city.&nbsp
column10: For the better part of an afternoon I spent assembling all of this stuff, and it really was a lot of fun doing so. Even if you have a small Lego city collection, this set instantly makes your town
column11: larger and includes vehicles/equipment you won't find anywhere else. All of this equipment fits comfortably on&nbsp
column14: even if you were to scatter the kiosks around your town wherever they'd fit, there is still an amazing amount of play value.
column15: You got your yellow sportscar, which is more or less an offshoot of the red ""sports car"" set with a couple extra touches...a really cool street cleaning vehicle, the HUGE bus, and of course the light rail train itself.
column17: have some really neat touches, such as the postcard stand, snack area, recycle bins and mailbox, plus a rare green bicycle with bike rack.
column18: My daughter absolutely loves the light rail and drives it around town with no tracks, but I guess
column20: you just have to use your imagination.
column21: One other set I got at the same time with an additional large grey baseplate is the new Train Station #7937-1. This all fits together great, and while I do not have any of the new train sets yet (afraid to spend even more money for trains, tracks, crossings...etc.), the light rail can rest on the 4 pcs of supplied track, and it looks like a huge transportation hub.
column22: All in all, a great set, and while a bit spendy, really does add to your town and is a lot of fun to build.
column24:
,TRUE,5,5,5,5,4 blaksamu12","2011-04-14T23:14:15.64Z","A great Christmas Present","

Lego City Public Transport is a great set. With 6 minifigures and 4 vehicles, its hard to say this is a bad set. I got it for Christmas along with the 2008 Police truck.

column1:
Minifigures:
Great additions to the set. There is a bus driver with standard back hair and the normal black and white sleeves suit. There is also the Tram conductor, which is pretty cool since he has a black suit and a black police hat. Next there is the driver for the Street Sweeper, which is my favorite minifigure in the set. The street sweeper guy has orange pants and a blue and orange top. There is a girl in the yellow sports car, which is good since girls are very hard to find in Lego form. Then there is some guy with long hair that goes with the GREEN bike. Lastly, there is a guy in a green shirt and blue pants with glasses on.
Minifigures: 5/5.

Platforms:
Not that great. Kinda wimpy and large. The shop platform is very small and cramped. The platform with the bike ramp is pathetic except for the glass part with stops and times. The best platform is the one with blue window pieces on top, since its small and has a simple but cool-looking design.
Platforms: 4/5.
<DIV class=BVRRReviewTextParagraph><SPAN class=BVRRReviewText>&nbsp

Vehicles:
The reason why I wanted this set. First there is the yellow sports car. The yellow car is kinda lame, and much to similiar to the red sport car. Next there is the Street Sweeper, which as and awesome design. I like the orange color and the back design. However, the front area where the driver sits is empty and small. The Tram is the longest vehicle and has a repetitive design. The back is eaxactly the same as the front, but the tram is still cool. I know there is some way to put a motor in the Tram to make it move atomatically. Anyway, the tram also has a TON of stickers, but I'll get into that later. Finally, my favorite part of the set, the Bus. Some people complain about the Bus, but I don't see any huge problems with it. It has a lot of space for a total of NINE minifigures and has little storage areas on the outside. The overall design of the Bus is nothing that I've seen before, and very fun to build. The only problem I can see is that some hair doesn't fit under the roof very well.
Vehicles: 5/5.

Other Stuff:
There are two overall cons to the set. One is the stickers. There is only one part that doesn't have stickers and thats the platform with the blue windows on top. Also, the price is a little high. I would have definately bought it on sale, but maybe not at its regular price. The price would have been reasonable if all the stickers were printed bricks. Overall, its still a great set, and I suggest you buy it if you can afford it. I rate it 9/10 overall.

:{)
",TRUE,5,5,5,5,5

stagus,"2011-08-31T05:53:27.887Z","Great city addition","

I am reviewing this as an AFOL with a fairly large city layout going on in my loft.
column2: This set is an excellent addition to my city but I would question it as a standalone set which is why I am giving it 4 out 5.&nbsp
column3: It is a fun build with a couple of unusual pieces of design (they are blinking clever at Lego I tell you!)

column1: Transport
The tram is very cool and cleverly done with a 'floating' axle underneath to allow the tram to go on corner rails.
column3: in the main with a few stickers.

column1: The bus is my favourite piece in the set.
column2: I love the fact that the driver is set lower than the seats, just like&nbsp
column3: real buses you see on the road.&nbsp

column1: The road sweeper is cool an looks fab.
column2: Nice brushes for the road and a nice squat design.

column1: Not sure that the sports car is public transport but it looks good none the less.
The building are ok.
column2: The glass roofed bus/tram terminal is really nice.&nbsp
column3: I have it stationed in my city such that you can get the tram on one side and buses on the other.&nbsp
column4: The other bus stop is fairly basic although the bike rack is a nice touch.&nbsp
column5: The wee kiosk is pretty cool with coffee and a postcard stand.

column1: Pros
<ul>
<li>The bus is magnificent
<li>Cool tram
<li>Will fit with anyones city
• Nice set of minifigs
Cons
<ul>
<li>More limited playability if you don't have other lego.
<li>Quite expensive.

Overall this is a good set if a bit pricey (over £80 in the uk) but I would recomend it to any city builders and any parents willing to splash this much on a box of Lego for their kids as they will have a lot of fun with the vehicles.
av8r1973,"2011-01-14T05:45:31.63Z","Adds content to your city, but not much on its own","This set just looked too cool not to get. &nbsp
column2: We have a fairly large metropolis set up in our living room and this adds some great impact to it. &nbsp
column3:
With 7 unique components, it should have been called something like ""City Infrastructure"", not ""Public Transport"".

After running through the brick ratings here, I realized I rated it pretty low.
column4: I realized why. This really is a nice set. &nbsp
column6: The build experience was completely standard, except for two specifics noted below. &nbsp
column7: The parts were all standard, as well (except one noted below). &nbsp
column8: The price was pretty high, but the part count was high as well. &nbsp
column9:
Just not remarkable as a set.

On to the good stuff, presented in order of my favorite components of the kit.

Bus: This bus is cool.
column11: bold move, but is pretty muted compared to most of the tour buses on the road here in Taiwan. &nbsp
column13: The solid glass passenger compartment, luggage boxes underneath, plethora of tail lights and tall mirrors represent the real tour bus or over the road coaches seen around the world. &nbsp
column15:
The lime green gave me some elements in a color just not seen much in LEGO. I would have been happy to be able to purchase this bus as a standalone kit!

Street Train: The train is a 3-part unit that strongly resembles street trains in a lot of major US and European cities today.
column17: The colors were nicely done and the tall skinny shape is very realistic. &nbsp
column18: Sliding doors would have been a nice addition, but it would have added a lot of complexity. &nbsp
column19: One cool building technique is the sliding axle on the middle car that lets it navigate curves in the track easily. &nbsp
column20: It slides back and forth very nicely and was a clever touch. &nbsp
column21: A new element for me was the front and rear windows. &nbsp
column22: Not sure where else I could use them, but they look great. &nbsp
column23: Disappointed there wasn't any provision to add motors. &nbsp
column24:
Just need to push it around my track.

Sweeper Truck: Not real original here, but i's a nice looking truck.
column25: The newer orange theme is a good color in my city and the blue sweeper elements are neat. &nbsp
column26: The second cool build technique is the floating sweepers on the truck. &nbsp
column27: They flex easily over the dirt on the carpet, so it looks pretty cool to me. &nbsp
column28:
The exhaust stack isn't very stable behind the cab - I am going to have to reengineer that.

Stops: Included are a separate bus stop that is all standard bricks.
column29: It came with a green bike, so that was nice. &nbsp
column30: The bike rack was a nice touch. &nbsp
column31:
The train station was pretty standard, but the overhead glass elements added a crisp, modern look to it.

Sports Car:
column32: A standard yellow 4-lug wide car was included. &nbsp
column33: Not sure why, since this is a ""public"" transport set. &nbsp
column34:
It's a nice little convertible that will still go nicely in my city.

Overall - it's a great set to add multiple elements to your city.
column35: Standalone, it may not do too much, since most of the units don't have much detail on their own. &nbsp
column36: Put them in a city setting and you get a lot of impact for not too much money.",TRUE,4,3,3,5,4

column1:
AlfaAnimations,"2011-01-24T02:31:31.113Z","Great","

Well, this set has served me well, it has been in a Number of Animations, and it is a AWESOME Lego city set,

city_transport_rox,"2011-10-21T03:27:24.177Z","One of lego city's finest......","

It just does not get any better than this! This is a great addition to your town, works perfect with the airport, comes with 6 minifigs and looks cool on display. It also has the first ever lego tram.

Box/Instructions

Comes with instruction booklets for each model of this set. The box is pretty cool and at the back it shows you the set in detail.

Parts

Some parts you have probably seen before, but there are some new bricks in this set and they work quite well. My favourite part is that black piece at the top of the tram (dunno what it is called). This set comes with over 800 pieces!!

Minifigures

There are six minifigs that come with this set: the tram driver, the bus driver, the street sweeper driver, a man in a green sweater with glasses, a man with long hair and a hoodie and of course a lady with brown hair.

The build

The build is fairly easy and the instructions are clear. I especially enjoyed building the bus (although the tram was also pretty fun).
column3:
"">TRAM
Lego's first ever tram. This is able to fit up to 6 passengers and there are to seats for the driver (1 one each end of the tram). The tram also fits on lego track new or old. The tram is my favourite part of this set and is the main reason i got it.
column7:
"">BUS
I may have gotten this set for the tram, but the bus is just as goo. It can also fit up to 6 passengers and the bus driver sits at the front with 2 doors next to him. The bus also has 2 storage cupboards on each side and can fit up to 2 suitcases in each cupboard. As i mentioned before, this bus is ideal for the airport.
column13:
"">STREET SWEEPER
The bus and the tram may be the stars of this set and less people notice the street sweeper. The street sweeper is also a good addition to your town. The back of the truck can open up and it comes with a broom clipped at the back. Another great part of this set.
column21:
"">SPORTS CAR
Many people think this is the same car as 8402. Wrong. This car is completely different. In fact, hardly any of the pieces are used from 8404 in this. The rich lady in this set drives this. You can never have too many cars.
column31:
"">PLATFORMS
3 platforms come with this set, each very different. Firstly there is the kiosk. The man with the green sweater works there. This platform is very detailed. There is a mailbox, postcard stand and a coffee machine. Next there is the platform with the bike stand, bench and recycling bin. It also has a timetable. Last but not least is the glass - roofed platform. It has a screen and also has a bench to sit on.
column32:
Summary

There are only a few problems to point out in this set. Firstly, there is no track for the tram. At the price u are paying you would expect at least some track. Thats why i had to go and buy some. Secondly, when i opened this, the stickers were all bent and i still have not ordered new ones. Lastly, the price is a little too expensive. Other than that it is a great set. If
column33: u are a transport fan like me, you will&nbsp
column35:
love this set. It is a great addition to your town and comes with plenty of minifigs.


",TRUE,5,5,5,4,4

column1:
donaldduckatti313,"2013-03-30T02:18:14.64Z","A great set missing some things...","

The box and its content

The box looks nice and illustrates some nice features of this set.

Inside, we get 9 bags and
column2: five (maybe four, I'm not sure anymore)&nbsp
column3:
books.

Building

The first build is the lady's car and a small station with a bike rack. It all looks quite nice, and the car has a pretty good design.

Second, we have a street sweeper. It has nice colour and a fairly average design, but beside the brushes it isn't very special.

Third, you build the thing that you got this set for. The tram! It has three carriages and carries six people and two drivers, although only one driver is in the set, and you have to use minifigures that you already have to fill all six seats since there are only six people in the whole set, and one of them is already the tram driver, another the bus driver, and another the sweeper driver, and yet one more is the pretty lady driving the yellow car. Also, the tram can easily be modified for eight passengers, by simly adding a rearwards facing seat in the fron and rear carriage.

Fourth, we have two more stations, one big with a large glass roof and the other smaller with a little kiosk.

Last comes the tourist bus, which says city transport but is a bit big to look good in a normal city. It has very few seats and once again can be modified to seat more people.

Conclusion

The set has a few nice parts, but just costs a little too much.

Pros:

  • A tram. This is good.
  • A big bus with a visually appealing design
  • Street sweeper and little car also look ok

Cons

  • Rails-where are they? For this price, they could have easily been in there.
  • The middle tram carriage cannot be accessed by figs other than using the roof...
  • The three stations are a bit mediocre. One big public transport station would have been better.
",TRUE,4,4,4,5,3

column1:
RichieBitchy,"2021-01-11T18:36:39.66Z","One of the Best City Sets of Its Time","

I remember when this set came out when I was about 9 or 10. It was a must-have since I had a whole train setup and display. Needless to say, this set did not disappoint. I would recommend it for any parent looking to give their kid lots of play value, for any collector looking to capture Lego City in its prime, or for any city builder looking for more detail and value to add to their display.

The set features an entourage of unique vehicles that were not regularly released at the time for the City subtheme. The Tram of course paralleled the Trains theme that was re-released around the same time. The coach bus was certainly unique. The street sweeper had a few iterations previously, and the yellow sports car of course is a great addition.

The tram station is really modern and sleek looking, but otherwise not much to write home about. I think my favourite part of this set as a kid was the little travel kiosk. No other set had featured something like that that offered a lot of depth and playability to the city streets. It features a transit map, a coffee maker, and a swivelling postcard stand.

The little bus stop was neat as well, with the bike rack and bench. At the time, Lego bikes were almost always red. This one came with a green bike, which added some much-needed variety. You also get a great cast of unique figures. Maybe could have done with one more, but six is still a decent amount.
The only gripe I had about this set was that it featured no tracks for the tram. I figured for 100USD, the least they could do was add a small oval-worth of track. But I had a train setup so it didn'
column2: t matter much to me. This is the only reason I give a &quot

column1: Overall, a great set to own and definitely one worth scouring eBay or Bricklinks for.
